<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/17/supply-chain-crisis-shows-signs-of-gradually-easing?mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Supply Chains Take a Laxative
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/17/supply-chain-crisis-shows-signs-of-gradually-easing?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A shipping container being picked up " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/d97e822f008b3f4ff8c477bc593ba944a40b53dc-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba </em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So sorry for that headline, but it’s honestly the best way to describe what’s happening right now. Which is that, slowly but surely, the supply chain bottlenecks that have plagued the global economy for over a year appear to be easing—or at least have been circumvented.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The country’s largest retailers all said in unison this week that supply chain snags won’t play the role of the Grinch this holiday shopping season.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The CEO of TJX, the parent company of TJ Maxx and HomeGoods, declared, “We are in an excellent inventory position” ahead of the holidays.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Target’s inventory </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/target-posts-strong-sales-and-says-it-has-plenty-in-stock-for-black-friday-11637148726?mod=hp_lead_pos2" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">surged 17.6%</a></span><span> last quarter. It said its investments in inventory and staffing mean “we are going to be there” when you walk in to buy that TV.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And remember the global chip shortage that was crippling the auto industry? That could be past its peak.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>GM said that the week of Nov. 1 was the first time since February that none of its North American assembly plants were offline due to a lack of chips.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Toyota’s production lines in Japan will return to normal operations in December for the first time in seven months.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Finally, let’s turn to shipping</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If we had to pick one visual that best represents the supply chain crisis, it would be the ~80 cargo ships waiting to unload their containers at LA ports. But that traffic jam, too, seems to be transitioning from “bumper-to-bumper” to “slow crawl.”</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The number of import containers at the Port of Los Angeles has </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-11-16/container-glut-eases-as-los-angeles-port-threatens-penalties?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dropped by 25%</a></span><span> since last month, thanks in part to a new fee on loitering containers.</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Meanwhile, the Baltic Dry Index (BDI), a measure of global shipping rates and an inflation indicator, has <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/11/10/inflation-may-cool-off-in-november-and-december-shipping-data-suggests.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">plummeted 50%</a> since peaking Oct. 7, another good sign for consumers.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>with Covid sticking around and labor shortages spanning the globe, bottlenecks could be annoyingly persistent. But the nightmare scenario of empty store shelves on Dec. 20 likely won’t materialize.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/17/drug-overdose-deaths-reached-6-figures-for-the-first-time?mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Drug Overdose Deaths, Led By Opioids, Hit a New Record
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Drug overdoses killed more than 100,000 people between April 2020 and April 2021, eclipsing six-figure deaths in a 12-month period for the first time and jumping 29% from the previous year, the CDC <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/health/health-news/yearly-drug-overdose-deaths-top-100000-first-time-rcna5656?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">revealed</a> yesterday. The synthetic opioid fentanyl fueled the rise, accounting for more deaths in one year than the entire number of overdose deaths from all drugs in 2016.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Appalachia remains a hard hit region, but Vermont recorded the largest increase with a 70% rise in overdose deaths.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> Covid + rising overdose deaths slashed US life expectancy in 2020 by 1.5 years, the biggest drop since World War II, according to a July report from the CDC. And while isolation caused by the pandemic may have been particularly challenging for drug users, every year for the past 26 years, the US has set a new drug overdose death record. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the Biden administration has promised to tackle the growing crisis. It urged Congress to approve $10 billion for drug treatment programs and asked states to increase access to naloxone, a lifesaving overdose-reversal medication. But the admin <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/11/17/1056484849/drug-overdose-deaths-100000-us?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shut down rumors</a> that it might take a stance on initiatives like safe drug-injection sites.—<em>MM</em></p>
</div>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/17/apple-lets-consumers-fix-their-own-devices?mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Apple Sings a New Tune on DIY Repair
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/17/apple-lets-consumers-fix-their-own-devices?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt=""Fix You" by Coldplay" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=370 src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-11-17/image-ee634d1eb77a30018f0d431914c57c4aca5fe2c8-480x265-gif/ezgif.com-gif-maker.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt='"Fix You" by Coldplay' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-11-17/image-ee634d1eb77a30018f0d431914c57c4aca5fe2c8-480x265-gif/ezgif.com-gif-maker.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Apple announced yesterday that its devices’ parts, tools, and manuals—which were previously only officially available to its in-store “geniuses” and other approved vendors—will soon be <a href="https://www.axios.com/apple-self-service-repair-iphone-ftc-61042bf9-d6a5-4e3c-b1b0-f01a9fea102a.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">available to all</a>, starting with the iPhones 12 and 13.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Apple’s move follows <a href="https://www.axios.com/right-to-repair-moment-5f5de22a-89dc-4cb3-8fea-33fa2ffe7f91.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">mounting pressure</a> from regulators to ease policies that make it more difficult for consumers to fix their own devices, such as directing them to authorized retailers and using parts that aren’t widely available. This year alone...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The first national bill on the issue was introduced in Congress in June, and 27 states are considering similar bills that make it easier for consumers to fix their own junk.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The FTC unanimously decided in July to increase enforcement against tech companies that impede consumers’ ability to repair their devices.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A group of Apple shareholders </span><span><a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/11/17/22787336/apple-right-to-repair-self-service-diy-reason-microsoft?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">urged</a></span><span> the tech giant in September to reconsider its pre-yesterday stance on the issue.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Apple setting its gadgets free is a big win for “right to repair” advocates, who argue that the high cost of professional tune-ups forces consumers to buy new products instead—good for tech giants, bad for the environment.<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Their suite of products are designed to work in the present and the future, all so you can feel confident that you’re set up for success.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To find the tools that are right for you, <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N1336236.3407870MORNINGBREW/B25555767.311167460;dc_trk_aid=504420236;dc_trk_cid=156369160;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=;ltd=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Lincoln Financial</a> wants you to take a moment and think about the following questions:</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/17/key-performance-indicators-november-17?mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Turns out all of those “disappointing” jobs reports from the summer were a lot less disappointing than we thought. From June through September, the Bureau of Labor Statistics underestimated job growth by 626,000 jobs, the <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/11/16/government-underestimated-job-growth/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">largest underestimation</a> by the BLS over a comparable time period dating back to 1979, according to a Washington Post analysis.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“I do not accept hardworking Americans paying more for gas because of anti-competitive or otherwise potentially illegal conduct.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">President Biden asked FTC Chair Lina Khan to <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2021/11/17/biden-ftc-investigate-oil-gas-companies-522804?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">investigate</a> potential “anti-consumer behavior” by energy companies to prop up gas prices at the pump, even while unfinished gasoline prices decline.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Underdog no more, a deaf football team takes California by storm. (<a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/11/15/us/riverside-california-deaf-football-team.html?unlocked_article_code=AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACEIPuonUktbfqohlSVUaBibIRp89rwOLn-POzLF5jXb6LSaSUzBDxqEZDoGOvknKYrZpbt83miiWTdoHMKMqQLY66N5jCHFXalvipIqYytNCKj8pqIm3UyRogcvEVu0xqHrhNDXnbbpznOP670qNbn3tWaPU1XclIQ1upcB1ZBr9jyxzs6TPEORz2dd02e5wRcwpAGddO1TZ-qXgGB58O92ZbhnD6gdQW-5RWD7bntT0-KtXOUwJSgqAFCUjlD56vNBMO9oXPLL8LAoieKf9hrYTDW9oLuS5FhddbIQ-ler9u-gL-DP8VKA&smid=url-share" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">New York Times</a>)</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/17/crypto-investors-want-to-buy-the-constitution?mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
You Say You Wanna Constitution
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/17/crypto-investors-want-to-buy-the-constitution?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="National Treasure" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/7bd8ec41cbf7063ca67be449f42b250456033ef9-770x470.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Disney</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">An extremely rare copy of the US Constitution will go up for auction at Sotheby’s at 6:30pm ET tonight. And in a move that would make Ben Gates drool, a group of crypto investors is rallying together to <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/11/17/crypto-investors-constitution/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">buy it</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How we got here:</strong> Seven days ago, crypto enthusiasts <a href="https://www.notboring.co/p/lets-buy-the-us-constitution?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">formed a DAO</a> (decentralized autonomous organization), which is a blockchain-based governance structure without hierarchical management. They set out to raise $20 million to purchase the document and “put The Constitution in the hands of The People” (though we must point out the original is already free to view at the National Archives).</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>When we went to bed last night, they had raised $32 million.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sotheby’s has said it would accept a winning bid from ConstitutionDAO. So, if the DAO can outbid all the pinkies-up private collectors, all its members will receive a torn-off scrap of the historic document. JK! They’ll get a “governance token” that allows them to vote on decisions such as where this copy of the Constitution should be exhibited.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>ConstitutionDAO was created in just three days and raised over $25 million in less than seven. No matter what happens tonight, it’ll show the world the lightning-fast speed with which a DAO can rally a community to meet a goal.<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew Mini: </strong>You know what to do. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/17/brew-mini-plug-in-cars?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Play the Mini here</a> and see if you can set a PR.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Three of these news headlines are real and one is faker than your mom saying it’s OK if you don’t come home for the holidays. Can you guess the odd one out?</p>

</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nECONOMY \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/17/supply-chain-crisis-shows-signs-of-gradually-easing?mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nSupply Chains Take a Laxative \n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/17/supply-chain-crisis-shows-signs-of-gradually-easing?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\" style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"A shipping container being picked up \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/d97e822f008b3f4ff8c477bc593ba944a40b53dc-1500x1000.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo sorry for that headline, but it’s honestly the best way to describe what’s happening right now. Which is that, slowly but surely, the supply chain bottlenecks that have plagued the global economy for over a year appear to be easing—or at least have been circumvented.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe country’s largest retailers all said in unison this week that supply chain snags won’t play the role of the Grinch this holiday shopping season.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe CEO of TJX, the parent company of TJ Maxx and HomeGoods, declared, “We are in an excellent inventory position” ahead of the holidays.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTarget’s inventory \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/target-posts-strong-sales-and-says-it-has-plenty-in-stock-for-black-friday-11637148726?mod=hp_lead_pos2\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esurged 17.6%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e last quarter. It said its investments in inventory and staffing mean “we are going to be there” when you walk in to buy that TV.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd remember the global chip shortage that was crippling the auto industry? That could be past its peak.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGM said that the week of Nov. 1 was the first time since February that none of its North American assembly plants were offline due to a lack of chips.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eToyota’s production lines in Japan will return to normal operations in December for the first time in seven months.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eFinally, let’s turn to shipping\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf we had to pick one visual that best represents the supply chain crisis, it would be the ~80 cargo ships waiting to unload their containers at LA ports. But that traffic jam, too, seems to be transitioning from “bumper-to-bumper” to “slow crawl.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe number of import containers at the Port of Los Angeles has \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-11-16/container-glut-eases-as-los-angeles-port-threatens-penalties?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edropped by 25%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e since last month, thanks in part to a new fee on loitering containers.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMeanwhile, the Baltic Dry Index (BDI), a measure of global shipping rates and an inflation indicator, has \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/11/10/inflation-may-cool-off-in-november-and-december-shipping-data-suggests.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplummeted 50%\u003c/a\u003e since peaking Oct. 7, another good sign for consumers.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ewith Covid sticking around and labor shortages spanning the globe, bottlenecks could be annoyingly persistent. But the nightmare scenario of empty store shelves on Dec. 20 likely won’t materialize.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nDrug Overdose Deaths, Led By Opioids, Hit a New Record\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDrug overdoses killed more than 100,000 people between April 2020 and April 2021, eclipsing six-figure deaths in a 12-month period for the first time and jumping 29% from the previous year, the CDC \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/health/health-news/yearly-drug-overdose-deaths-top-100000-first-time-rcna5656?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erevealed\u003c/a\u003e yesterday. The synthetic opioid fentanyl fueled the rise, accounting for more deaths in one year than the entire number of overdose deaths from all drugs in 2016.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAppalachia remains a hard hit region, but Vermont recorded the largest increase with a 70% rise in overdose deaths.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e Covid + rising overdose deaths slashed US life expectancy in 2020 by 1.5 years, the biggest drop since World War II, according to a July report from the CDC. And while isolation caused by the pandemic may have been particularly challenging for drug users, every year for the past 26 years, the US has set a new drug overdose death record. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe Biden administration has promised to tackle the growing crisis. It urged Congress to approve $10 billion for drug treatment programs and asked states to increase access to naloxone, a lifesaving overdose-reversal medication. But the admin \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/11/17/1056484849/drug-overdose-deaths-100000-us?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshut down rumors\u003c/a\u003e that it might take a stance on initiatives like safe drug-injection sites.—\u003cem\u003eMM\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eApple announced yesterday that its devices’ parts, tools, and manuals—which were previously only officially available to its in-store “geniuses” and other approved vendors—will soon be \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/apple-self-service-repair-iphone-ftc-61042bf9-d6a5-4e3c-b1b0-f01a9fea102a.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eavailable to all\u003c/a\u003e, starting with the iPhones 12 and 13.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eApple’s move follows \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/right-to-repair-moment-5f5de22a-89dc-4cb3-8fea-33fa2ffe7f91.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emounting pressure\u003c/a\u003e from regulators to ease policies that make it more difficult for consumers to fix their own devices, such as directing them to authorized retailers and using parts that aren’t widely available. This year alone...\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe first national bill on the issue was introduced in Congress in June, and 27 states are considering similar bills that make it easier for consumers to fix their own junk.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe FTC unanimously decided in July to increase enforcement against tech companies that impede consumers’ ability to repair their devices.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eA group of Apple shareholders \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/11/17/22787336/apple-right-to-repair-self-service-diy-reason-microsoft?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eurged\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the tech giant in September to reconsider its pre-yesterday stance on the issue.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eApple setting its gadgets free is a big win for “right to repair” advocates, who argue that the high cost of professional tune-ups forces consumers to buy new products instead—good for tech giants, bad for the environment.\u003cem\u003e—JW\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eDisney\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAn extremely rare copy of the US Constitution will go up for auction at Sotheby’s at 6:30pm ET tonight. And in a move that would make Ben Gates drool, a group of crypto investors is rallying together to \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/11/17/crypto-investors-constitution/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebuy it\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow we got here:\u003c/strong\u003e Seven days ago, crypto enthusiasts \u003ca href=\"https://www.notboring.co/p/lets-buy-the-us-constitution?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eformed a DAO\u003c/a\u003e (decentralized autonomous organization), which is a blockchain-based governance structure without hierarchical management. They set out to raise $20 million to purchase the document and “put The Constitution in the hands of The People” (though we must point out the original is already free to view at the National Archives).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhen we went to bed last night, they had raised $32 million.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSotheby’s has said it would accept a winning bid from ConstitutionDAO. So, if the DAO can outbid all the pinkies-up private collectors, all its members will receive a torn-off scrap of the historic document. JK! They’ll get a “governance token” that allows them to vote on decisions such as where this copy of the Constitution should be exhibited.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eConstitutionDAO was created in just three days and raised over $25 million in less than seven. No matter what happens tonight, it’ll show the world the lightning-fast speed with which a DAO can rally a community to meet a goal.\u003cem\u003e—JW\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\"
